_title_display: The apocryphal New Testament : being all the gospels, epistles, and other pieces now extant attributed in the first four centuries to Jesus Christ, His apostles and their companions, and not included in the New Testament by its compilers : translated from the original tongues and now first collected into one volume.

description.value: Reprint of William Hone's edition, first published 1820, which incorporated the translations of Jeremiah Jones for the apocryphal books and of Archbishop Wake for the Apostolic fathers. See M.R. James, The apocryphal New Testament.

"A list of all the apocryphal pieces not now extant, mentioned by writers in the first four centuries of Christ, with the several works wherein they are cited or noticed. By the Rev. Jeremiah Jones," p. 179-181.
"A list of the Christian authors of the first four centuries, whose writings contain catalogues of the books of the New Testament. By the Rev. Jeremiah Jones," p. 182-183.

identifier.volume: Getty Research Institute digitized version (Internet Archive)

title.value: The apocryphal New Testament : being all the gospels, epistles, and other pieces now extant attributed in the first four centuries to Jesus Christ, His apostles and their companions, and not included in the New Testament by its compilers : translated from the original tongues and now first collected into one volume.
